dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, early release? That's a big deal. So, like, where is he serving his time right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, early release? That's a big deal. So, like, where is he serving his time right now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's in a medium-security facility in Stepnogorsk. And just to clarify, Kuandyk Bishimbayev, his brother, is in the same city, but a *different* facility, maximum-security. So, you know, not together.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, okay, so they're not, like, sharing a cell block or anything. Different institutions entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, okay, so they're not, like, sharing a cell block or anything. Different institutions entirely.

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Yntykbayev explained they're in different parts of the city, too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, this amnesty… how does that work for him? Is it like a parole situation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, this amnesty... how does that work for him? Is it like a parole situation?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he *will* be eligible to apply for parole starting summer 2025. But beyond that, he can already request a change in the type of punishment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he will be eligible to apply for parole starting summer twenty twenty five. But beyond that, he can already request a change in the type of punishment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yntykbayev noted that starting in the summer of 2025, his client will have the right to apply for parole. ... He added that Baizhanov can already request a change in the type of punishment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay. And the application for that, like, does it go straight to the court?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay. And the application for that, like, does it go straight to the court?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, it's submitted through the prison administration first. They gather all his documents—character profile, commendations, you know, stuff like that—then pass it to the Stepnogorsk court.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, it's submitted through the prison administration first. They gather all his documents-character profile, commendations, you know, stuff like that-then pass it to the Stepnogorsk court.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The application is submitted through the prison administration, not directly to the court. First, the facility gathers all necessary documents: his character profile, commendations, certificates. These are then passed to the Stepnogorsk court, said Yntykbayev.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Got it. So, he *does* fall under this new amnesty law then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Got it. So, he does fall under this new amnesty law then?

dialogue_turns.text: He does, but it's important to note, it's not full exemption from criminal liability. He falls into the second category, meaning his remaining sentence might be reduced by, like, one-third.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He does, but it's important to note, it's not full exemption from criminal liability. He falls into the second category, meaning his remaining sentence might be reduced by, like, one-third.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The lawyer confirmed that Baizhanov does fall under the amnesty law, but he will not be fully released from criminal liability. There are two categories: full exemption from criminal liability, and partial, where the sentence is reduced. Baizhanov falls into the second category ' his remaining sentence may be reduced by one-third, since the crime is considered serious, Yntykbayev clarified.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Baizhanov falls into the second category ' his remaining sentence may be reduced by one-third, since the crime is considered serious, Yntykbayev clarified. Baizhanov was convicted of covering up the murder of Saltanat Nukenova, the civil partner of former Minister of National Economy Kuandyk Bishimbayev.

dialogue_turns.text: Ah, that makes sense. So he was sentenced to four years in May, right?

dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And don't forget, he was in pre-trial detention from November 2023 to July 2024, where one day counts as 1.5 days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And don't forget, he was in pre-trial detention from November twenty twenty three to July twenty twenty four, where one day counts as one point five days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Astana police, Baizhanov was arrested on November 12, 2023. From then until July 2024, he was held in a pre-trial detention center, where one day counts as 1.5 days toward the sentence.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that'll shave off some time. So with the amnesty and that, what's the estimate?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that'll shave off some time. So with the amnesty and that, what's the estimate?
